website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung ML-2010 markedly improves on its predecessor but remains a personal laser rather than a serious business printer.
pros: easy to set up and use

customer_reviews.title: How prices change!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer about 6 years ago, here at Amazon. I paid around $90 for it at that time, and I am amazed that it now lists new for $445. I do not understand, since most electronics go down in price as time passes. This printer worked well for about 9 months, was very economical with the toner used. One day, it would not print more than one page at a time without jamming/stopping. Since I know this, I have to "give it a hand" when the subsequent pages print, after the first one. Do not use it much, so I will be keeping it for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good workhorse (personal laser printer used in work setting)
customer_reviews.text: Good workhorse for the office, yet rated for personal use. Lasted us longer than expected. After a few years, the fuser roller gets weaker to melt the toner to the paper; and the pickup roller tends to miss the 2nd part of the paper delivery to the drum. So we cleaned the rubber surface of the roller, and its good for another month. We bought another for extented use in the office (software is friendlier to old XP or Millenium PCs.
customer_reviews.author: RzKs

customer_reviews.title: Good for Mac but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer a few years ago. After downloading the drivers from the Samsung site, I've had no issues with this printer. It seems that with many printers, the claims of compatibility are minimal compared with what is offered to the Windows OS. The only complaint with this printer is that it is very, very loud. I also understand that it's an energy hog as well. I would still be using it, but a lightning storm, even when connected to a surge protector, fried it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this printer! You will be satisfied if you run a small office. The "noise" when printing, in my view, is very reasonable. I don't see what the big deal is as others have reviewed. All laser printers, in my experiences in several offices, make a sound when printing. The quality is very good. I use the printer to print neighborhood maps where street detail is important. It is very compact and simple to use. You can't go wrong with this machine - exceptional value!
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: This printer rocks...highly reccomend it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for 4 years and it goes and goes and goes. I have refilled the cartridge 3x's and I now have to buy a new cartridge. The good deal is that they are $20- $30. on ebay/amazon awsome. So if you know how to refill a laser printer cartridge your good to go if not the new cartridges cost very low now. I have probably printed off over 10,000 papers and its still going strong. Thx Samsung !! I will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Chaffee

customer_reviews.title: Samsung printer
customer_reviews.text: good quality print for cost. only complaints is that the paper tray isn't deep enough to hold more than 50 sheets of paper. It occasionally jams and the paper feed doesn't have a release for the paper jam so you have to fight to pull it out. I am fairly satisfied otherwise as I only use it for school to print up notes and papers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kass

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great for the price, especially if you get the mail-in rebate. We had some trouble with printing on cardstock when using the manual feed tray (it kept jamming). But we found that if you put the cardstock in the bottom tray and print one at a time, then it works much better. I've been happy with the printer!
customer_reviews.author: xeero

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Got the Samsung printer for $50 ($100 at Amazon less $50 manufacturer rebate) - a phenomenal price. The printer *does* take longer to warm up for a print than an inkjet, but not significantly. (i.e. printing to pages is probably the same total time as two pgs with an inkjet) Replacing the toner is $70, but the toner lasts MUCH longer than inkjet cartridges. Very satisfied so far, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Fox

customer_reviews.title: good purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect item for printing out school work documents since I don't need color. I haven't gone through a cartridge yet, but I am hoping it lasts as long as my old Samsung printer. It is much more economical to use that replacing the inkjet cartridges, and speed is right where i need it. Four stars because it is a little noisy. The $50 rebate was a plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain girl

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great printer, as good as any other 5 or 6 times the price. The Samsung ML-2010 was a snap to setup and the print is very crisp and clear. Its a steal at $57.00 after the MIR, and it was delivered the next day. I can't get over it a Laser printer!!Thanks Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Good little printer
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for almost 3 years now and it's held up well. Toner lasts much longer than specified. Rarely jams (even though I often forget to pull staples out when re-using paper).
customer_reviews.author: Kuiper84

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is, but its NOT NETWORKABLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because I needed a small ethernet laser printer. I ended up with this one because it was small and cheap, had good reviews, and the Samsung web page said it had an optional ethernet adapter. So once I bought it, I searched around to find the ethernet adapter. Finally I emailed Samsung and they said their site was wrong. So, as great as this printer is for a USB printer, I bought it because it was advertised as a networkable printer, and it is not.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: great personal affordable printer
customer_reviews.text: one of the cheapest ink cartridges for the money. efficient does the job. bought 2 for the office. buy it!
customer_reviews.author: SG-CK

customer_reviews.title: So far it is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a few months now in my classroom. I have my computer hooked up to it and I have had to use it as my main "copy machine" several time because of the copy machine being down and it has performed just great. No problems. Good quality. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Schrock

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Lazer Printer
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the speed with which the printer prints. The only objectional item that I would list is that of noise. It is not a big problem but in a quiet office it could become a problem. Have not had the unit long enough to evaluate the long term reliability. I have not received the rebate as yet but expect it any day.
customer_reviews.author: J. HICKMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: I received my Samsung ML-2010 in very short order. To date it has been a very reliable printer and is supposed to be a very easy one to add toner from a "Refill Kit" I also ordered at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Samsung ML-2010
customer_reviews.text: A great value. I found it a bit noisy at times, but really fast and inexpensive. The toner saver for non-critical documents is a great way to save toner costs. It is a perfect small home office printer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but good product.
customer_reviews.text: Can't be any cheaper than this. Works extremely well. Fast enough. Low cost per page. Highly recommended. Have 4 of them for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great for SOHO use
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my home office and it works great. I had a Samsung before this one and it lasted 3 years. For this price, this printer is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: If I had it to do over I would spend an extra $100 and buy a printer with higher resolution for better graphics. However, if you print mainly text this is a good everyday printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T. Frey

customer_reviews.title: ML-2010 Laser
customer_reviews.text: The printer was easy enough to set up, but the picture quality, especially printing photos is fair to poor...in addition the main reason I bought this was to print on Vellum and Cardstock for my daughter's wedding invites which she had designed. The fee mechanism jammed about every 10 pages of vellum, and the cardstock would be inexorably curled up after feeding thru the printer...great for printing regular text pages as well as low res graphics...would probably buy a higher end LaserJet printer with an ejection out the back of the printer so the curling would be alleviated.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect home office printer
customer_reviews.text: Samsung has produced an excellant laser printer with this model. Affordably priced and easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Holt

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: It works fine during the first days, but now it does not work, where I can get some help?
customer_reviews.author: Nan Zhang

customer_reviews.title: UNDISCLOSED INFORMATION, READ CAREFULLY
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE SAMSUNG EQUIPMENT, I JUST LIKE MY EQUIPMENT TO BE NEW AND NOT REFURBISHED. I DO NOT KNOW IF THE PRINTER WAS WORKING OR NOT, I RETURNED IT WITHOUT IT BEING OPENED. I HAVE NEVER RECEIVED REFURBISHED EQUIPMENT BEFORE.
customer_reviews.author: Andra Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for the price!!! Very easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Proios

customer_reviews.title: Come'On!
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with the usb a/usb b cable...How stupid is that not to include all the needed cables...come 'on amazon and samsung, get with the program. How the H*** was I supposed to know I needed to shell out another $20 bucks for a stupid cable that should be included. BOO!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with a data cable
customer_reviews.text: Great delivery, great price...but no warning anywhere that you need to purchase a USB cable separately. I lost my enthusiasm for this product as I drove to a less than convenient computer store just to get the printer working.
customer_reviews.author: C. Long

customer_reviews.title: Using wiith Windows and Linux
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Samsung ML2010 laser printer in July of 2006. I am using it with both Windows and Linux (Fedora distro). It is still going as a champ. It rarely jams, when it does jams it is easy to clear. For a few years I have been using Samsung OEM laser cartridges which are pretty expensive. Then I switched to compatibles and had pretty good luck with them. The print quality is just as good and they last just as long. I use the printer every week but not for a huge number of pages, each cartridge lasts me around 1 year and a half. Ali Julia review
customer_reviews.author: Ali Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer for a very reasonable price after rebate, and I couldn't be more thrilled with it. It is a bit loud, but it cranks out pages very quickly. The print quality is acceptable to me. Some reviewers complained of gray text but it looks dark enough to me. It's also pretty small for a laser printer, and fits well under my bed. I've also used it with Windows XP, OS X 10.4.7 and Ubuntu Breezy Badger -- and it worked perfectly in all 3 operating systems! As another reviewer pointed out, you can use the ML 1710 driver in Ubuntu.
customer_reviews.author: B. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: good for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: ppl need to calm down, goodness these reviews are soo whiny, complaining about every little thing. Yes, its a little noisy but I'm use to having cheap lexmark printers and those are way louder than this. I've had no issues with paper jams. It may print in gray but unless ur using a magnifying glass, how would u know!! I print many notes for class and numerous projects. This printer is fast and very cost efficient!! I got it cheaper from craigslist and I love my printer!
customer_reviews.author: Monica I

customer_reviews.title: Total dud.  Landfill it.
customer_reviews.text: Put simply this product does not work. I have barely 200 pages of print off of this model before it simply failed to feed paper. Investigating the issue the rubber roller that feeds the paper is all dried out and cracking. The printer is basically new and parts are already faulty on the item. It is a piece of JUNK. Samsung I thought was a reliable mfgr. They have ruined their reputation with this product. The only thing to turn my opinion around with Samsung is if they replace this item free of charge with printer that works past 200 copies.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Not dark enough
customer_reviews.text: Even with toner savings mode turned off and dark turned up all the way, it's still too light. Yes, I've tried 1 2nd cartridge, namebrand. Just having to turn the toner saver off and select dark means every single printout you have to click-click-click. The paper just hangs out, bent, and over time gets permanently bent. The plastic holders are exposed and break easily.
customer_reviews.author: The Bernmeister

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as hell!
customer_reviews.text: Owned it for over 6 years, not a glitch to it, No glamour, no color, but reliable as hell. 3rd Party cartridges are down to $12. and lasting me over a year. Forget Inkjets! Unless you need to print color get one of these. I paid about $120. for mine though.
customer_reviews.author: VinceP

customer_reviews.title: still reliable after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased on Black Friday of 2007 for a very low price. After 3 years of less than average usage, the printer and original ink still have not failed. It prints quite quickly as well. Being an older model printer, I did have to find a download online (free) in order for my newer computer to recognize it. Made in China, but seems OK. No toxic, fumey odors.
customer_reviews.author: HKDAVEY68

customer_reviews.title: For the Price Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: First, the print is fine for every day work. Yes, it is loud, but it is a really reliable printer. It also works with LINUX. I have it on a network via a print server and it works with my windows and linux system. Samsung, also makes the same printer for Dell under a different name (Dell model #)
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic laser printer for the price. Prints fast and very clean...so much better than the inkjet I've used the past 7 years. As others have noted, the only downside is the sound. When warming up it's quite loud and then after it prints a fan runs for about 5 minutes before it goes into power save mode. Fan noise is quite noticeable in a small room/office. (...) Also, as others have noted, no USB cable comes with the printer. As (...) Also, I've read that you can refill the stock cartridge by drilling a hole and putting your own toner in. (...)
customer_reviews.author: Silt

customer_reviews.title: I like Samsung, but I won't be buying another printer from them...
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap printer, but not worth it. It runs out of toner quickly, and it's really slow (I'm used to HP III, 4MV, etc...). It quit feeding envelopes unless I pushed by hand and you've gotta push them at just the right second. Last week, after trying to print the same envelope 12 times, I took the printer out into the parking lot to see how high I could throw it. This was my most satisfying moment with this printer...
customer_reviews.author: Larry & Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer a few months ago and it has been great. It prints really fast and the quality is pretty good. It is a little bit loud when it is printing. It isnt that big of a deal to me because it prints so fast. Once it finishes printing it is silent though. But if you are in an office or something and are printing things all day long I would probably not recomend this printer. I really like the toner save feature also. This printer is very economical and I would recomend it to anyone who wants to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Sams0n

customer_reviews.title: Sunil
customer_reviews.text: It is a good printer for the price I guess. But if you ever need to print on envelopes, buy something else, because it is a tremendous pain to do so with this printer. It takes about 60 seconds to print a single envelope and you must feed the envelopes one at a time, because any more than one envelope in the envelope slot will jam it up. Otherwise, the quality of print is good, but it could definitely be less frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Re: Got what I paid
customer_reviews.text: After a year of light use, it started to jam so ofter that I wanted to trash it. But I still have a spare toner sitting there. Sigh. It helps if you push the paper a bit when it feeds. But it is annoying. Not recommend for any usage. Two stars for the price I paid. Otherwise, one star.
customer_reviews.author: Radio man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Excellent Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I never bother with writing reviews, especially if I am satisfied with the product, but this printer is exceptional. I am a complete technophobe and don't know anything about anything technical, but this printer was so easy to install it practically started up right out of the box. Its also so incredibly cheap, which made me skeptical about its quality, but the printing is crisp and clear, it prints lightening fast and in my opinion its not noisy at all. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for an extremely low cost, high quality printer.
customer_reviews.author: L. Peoples

customer_reviews.title: Prints in Grey
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking printer with a small footprint. It is better than the average home laser printer in terms of speed, noise and operational cost per page. If you can live with grey print, then this is for you. However, I need black print and this printer won't deliver. This is my second machine and it has the same problem. The only remedy Samsung Tech Support offered was to exchange my new printer for a used one at my shipping expense. And, they did so with an irritating attitude. I will never buy another laser printer without seeing the output in person. the 2010 is a great machine except for its printed output and the support. How unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Perry

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable printer
customer_reviews.text: My school charges a lot of money for printing. That was my initial reason to buy this printer. I print my class handouts almost everyday. Printing speed and quality are both great. As a laser printer, the price(110$) was affordable, too. With a limited budget, I think this is the most competitive laser printer in market as far as I searched through. If you need to print a lot of stuff at home, this printer might fit to your purpose.
customer_reviews.author: S. KWON

customer_reviews.title: Donnot buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: My professor insisted to get this printer for our daily printing job, and now this machine is annoying to me. It prints Gray color, not black, no matter how hard I have tried the settings. I just need the right color, black, to print my Ph.D. dissertation, that is all. Donnot be alured by the price, the cheap price gives you an output that looks cheap. Donnot buy this one if you need to produce decent document.
customer_reviews.author: CS Doctor

customer_reviews.title: rev123
customer_reviews.text: The printer is small and looks great. It is very fast and print qaulity is also good. My only complain is that when I press the one touch toner save buttone, the toner save light does not come on. The only way I can put the printer in toner save mode is to set it from the print menu. This does not bother me so much. This is a great printer considering the price of $60 or so afger rebate.
customer_reviews.author: Shareq Rahman

customer_reviews.title: leaves smudges on resume paper
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to print official correspondence on, mainly resumes. However, every so often (every 20 pages?) I don't know why it leaves a dirty mark. Usually a smudge at the top. I have to print again and dump my expensive resume paper. Quite annoying. Also, keep in mind these small laser printers tend not to be as dark as inkjets. I got mine for $[...] after rebate, so look around for that deal.
customer_reviews.author: Living bicoastal

customer_reviews.title: Great laser for the price but jams
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for $50 after discounts for school use. Jams ALL the time: often pulls 2 sheets from the paper tray, and when it heats up the pages start to stick together. I have to watch it very closely whenever printing anything over 10 pages, ready to fight with the bugger if it starts to jam. When it jams, things really get stuck because the internal rollers are very tight and don't move. Printing is a Also, very noisy: it squeaks a lot and you can hear the rollers inside. Okay for light use but get a better printer if you need to print more than just a few pages now and then! I wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Decent Home Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned the ML-2010 for about 6 months. During that time I have been pleasantly surprised by it. It is a decently economical, fast, and attractive printer. While I wouldn't recommend it to someone who wanted to print graphics, this is an excellent printer for the home office.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Larkin

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR  PRINTING QUALITY  -  SAMSUNG ML-2010
customer_reviews.text: I never write reveiws, but in this case I had to: the quality of the printing was so poor. Like other reviewers, it prints grey not black no matter what you do. Also, there's banding. Plus, you get nowhere near 3,000 pages with the toner. Also, I saw no difference between the 1200 and 600 dpi setting. It also disturbed my power source. What else can I say? Samsung should be ashamed of turning out such a poor machine. Too bad there are not lemon laws for laser printers.
customer_reviews.author: Media Enterprises, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Buying a Replacement Cartridge
customer_reviews.text: When my HP Laserjet 4P ran out of toner, I found this printer at half the price of a new toner cartridge at CompUSA. Printer came with a new toner cartridge. It prints fine and very fast. For the price, it is the best deal. I did make following observations: 1. When warming up, draws high power as other lights in room goes dim. 2. USB connection port on printer holds the connector loose. Still, the deal is un-beatable. Next time when I will need a new toner cartridge, I will look for a similar deal.
customer_reviews.author: Akhtar Naqvi

customer_reviews.title: good printer, a bit loud
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer for our office, printing a few hundred b&w pages per day. We wanted a printer without too many bells and whistles, and primarily one that had an ink cartridge capable of printing LOTS of pages without needing replacing. The printer does exactly that. The only drawback is that it is a bit louder than it seems it should be. Other than that it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Crain

customer_reviews.title: great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This printer far exceeded my expectations for the price ($50 after rebate). I expected it to be slow, or have mediocre quality, but it's actually quite fast and the quality has been decent so far. (I'm just doing basic B&W documents, no photos.) It can be a little noisy just after it prints, but the noise doesn't last long. I had an Epson Stylus CX4600 and i spent more in replacement cartridges in the 4 months than I spent on this entire Samsung Laser Printer.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Sun

customer_reviews.title: This is the crappiest piece of crap I've ever had the misfortion of owning.
customer_reviews.text: While I've always found printers to be a problematic sort, this one takes the cake. It doesn't work half the time, and when it does it's very temperamental. Only one button and terrible OSX support means it's impossible to fix software problems!
customer_reviews.author: lauryl

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I have Windows XP PC and MAC (Tiger). Both are working fine with this printer without any problems. Setup was easy and quick. Some folks mentioned in earlier reviews about setup issues with MAC, but I didn't run into any issues at all. Print quality is great. Prints are Black in 'Normal' mode and in 'Toner Save' mode it is dark grey, which is fine for regular home use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Banga

customer_reviews.title: Good to introduce
customer_reviews.text: The good thing is it is so fast to print than I expected. Bad thing is the color of letter is not so dark even though I made it dark in the setting. And it's hard to print both sides because I have to do first for front pages and then do back pages later. It makes me confused. Another thing is all languge for setting the program is Korean. I am Korean but how other persons can make setting the soft program. However, generally, I am so satisfied with this materials. Especially, the price is so attractive and fancy and small shape. It's encourageable.
customer_reviews.author: H. Park

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is good but not too much better than my old HP Deskjet 600C. Due to the heat inside the machine, the copies are curled up & don't lay flat even after days on the desk. I can't undestand how you can purchase a brand new printer including the print cartridge for less than the price of a replacement print cartridge. Something is wrong here. Why buy a cartridge when you can get a brand new printer for less. Noisy & doesnt include USB cable.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert W. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: This printer constantly jams. Usually when I'm trying to print on the second side. So, I'll get 20 pages just fine, then it'll jam on the backside and ruin the page numbering. I'm no tree hugger, but I feel bad about wasting almost 40 pages each time I try to print a chapter for school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a good refurbished item
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good printer for the price I paid. It replaced the QMS Konica 1100L that never work right, because Konica did not provide a suitable software for their printer !! what a shame !! I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chuong Tong

customer_reviews.title: Inferior quality
customer_reviews.text: You could not print 3 pages continously without jamming ( the printer would pick up 2 to 3 pages from the paper tray at the same time and end up jam itself ). The only way to get around is to manually feed the paper one by one. I have noticed this problem ever since I got it as a gift( it's the reason I did not return it ). I think it's a product design flaw. I hope anyone who is thinking about buying this printer see this message.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lee

customer_reviews.title: A total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked fine for about 2 months and then I had one paper jam, which seemed to clear easily enough. But the "error" LED never cleared, despite turning the printer off, waiting 15 minutes, turning it back on, resetting the network connection, reinstalling the printer on my computer, removing and reinstalling the toner cartridge, etc.... Now the printer is completely unusable. I wouldn't bother repairing it even if someone came to my house. It is going in the garbage (well, to the hazard waste recycling) and being replaced by an HP.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Sumsung printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good printer for the small price. What I hate most is the refill catridges often cost more than the printer itself. When are machine builders becoming more reasonable and sensible to consumer needs. Yes, refills are neccessary but its more like gauging the customer than providing a reputable machine. For instance, the Konica/Minolta Pagepro is $99 with a $50 rebate. The catridge is $74 plus tax. What's wrong with this picture. How can a refill catridge costs more than the machine. In this case, the Samsung printer is identical. $105 for the printer with a $50 rebate but the refill catridge is $70 plus. Ouch.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E. Wong

customer_reviews.title: My next laser printer probably won't be a Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for light duty printing. 5-6 pages per week. Toner ran empty quickly. After about 2 years, the paper feed just stopped working. It was a cheap printer but I did not get my money's worth. Not recommended for any type of printing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: compact, efficient, great price, works great
customer_reviews.text: jnust like advertised, the ml-2010 is compact and fits nicely in the smallest locations. it prints fast, it was easy to connect to our netwrok, and is very efficient. the only thing i dont know about is how long will the toner last, and how expensive will it be to replace, becasue we have not gotten to taht point yet. its a great printer
customer_reviews.author: Online purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Loud but good
customer_reviews.text: The ML-2010 is really LOUD in my small workspace, but it fits very nicely. A great printer for a college student because of its small footprint and clean, inexpensive printouts. It does print lighter than larger laser printers, but if that is really a problem, just bold-text the document.
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary Guy

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: I searched the customer reviews before I decided to buy this printer. People seem to like it except for its noise. However, I didn't find the sound is too loud. It runs smoothly, and the printing qulity is good. Paper jam and curved papers haven't happened yet. I recommand this compact laser printer to people with limited budget.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. S.

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jam!  Paper Jam! Near Toner Cartridge!
customer_reviews.text: Despite the title, there are no paper jams. Instead - after about 6 months - the unit just tells me that there is a paper jam, when there isn't, every time I try to print something. I only paid about $80 for it, but I was hoping it would last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: toyzbin

customer_reviews.title: Good printer considering its price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because of its cheap price, but it turn out to be very good. It was easy to install, and print quality is reasonably good. One drawback is loud noisy, but it didn't bother me much.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Hyuk Song

customer_reviews.title: Fuser Error
customer_reviews.text: Got a fuser error after 2 days using this printer. It is covered under warrantee but I have to take it to a Samsung service center that is 20 miles away. I have to make this trip twice because they refuse to order the part until I bring them the printer to look at. Also their service center is only open Monday-Friday 9-5 which makes the commute pretty annoying. Unreliable product, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best buy in a black and white lazer printer there is. I use it on the road all the time and gives me professional documents every time. It is compact enough to fit almost anywhere and the cartridge lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A. Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Samsung ML-100 Mono Laser Ptinter Review
customer_reviews.text: This product was just what I was looking for. Black and White only and very fast which is what I wanted. It was easy to asemble and the print has excellent contrast. I must wait to see if it saves printing dollars over a normal cartridge printer. The toner is double the price of a normal cartridge but I fell it should last over twice as long.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Watters

customer_reviews.title: A very erratic printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these printers and they have both stopped working. The first just quit within 6 months. The second started out OK, then began stopping while printing in the middle of the page then stopped working all together. I won't buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Shevenaugh

customer_reviews.title: great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer hits the sweet spot for my home printing needs. I use a multifunction for color jobs, copying, and scanning, and use this one for high quality, fast, cost effective black and white printing. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Sinwell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good printer
customer_reviews.text: I have used it one month, and it works very well. I do not think the noise when it starts bother me much, and it is indeed a good choice for a simple but inexpensive laser-printer. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sgt

customer_reviews.title: Reliable even for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a few months now, and its absolutely wonderful. Crisp print and very fast. No problems as yet!
customer_reviews.author: sportybales

customer_reviews.title: Samsung ML 2010
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer ever...I had this printer for 4 years and never give me any issues other than paper and toner... I would recommended this printer for any job....
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: [...]. Have used it every day for last three years. Prints great, cartridges are cheap. Has never failed. I'd go thru three inkjet printers in the same time...and they are all disposables! Samsung makes great products...tv's too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Good for student
customer_reviews.text: The price is very competitive with other printers. Very reliable for students. Only the noice after opening for a few minutes. Toner also reasonable price about $70 for about 1000 pages. Very useful for me.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Good value, a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality printouts. Price couldn't be beat with the rebate. Only complaint is the noisy cooldown period after printing anything. It seems that for about 5 minutes after printing a loud fan has to cool down the printer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Deal
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with thequality of the product. Given the price I could not have asked for more! Makes some noise when operating but it is not too bothersome. The Toner Save option is helpful in economic use of the cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Manish Kumar

customer_reviews.title: good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first home laser printer, good alternative to my old inkjet printer. So far no complaints works fine much faster than the old one, and good quality printouts. but still waiting for my mail-in-rebate
customer_reviews.author: G. srinivasan

customer_reviews.title: sumsung ml 2010 printer is great!
customer_reviews.text: The ink cartridge is very easy to change (we use black ink only), the printer works fast enough for us for home use. It is very solid and dependable. It also is easy to get at papers that are stuck. we are very satisfied with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Slowey

customer_reviews.title: worth the money spent
customer_reviews.text: This printer is worth the money spent.Very useful when you have school going kids to meet their school needs.got a good deal on the printer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Budidi

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: The USB cable is not included, and it gets really hot when printing stuff. But basically, it's good!
customer_reviews.author: Ybabtrams

customer_reviews.title: OK, but there are better values out there.
customer_reviews.text: Tried this printer. Not impressed at all. Quality not as good my previous one (Konica Minolta PagePro 1400W). Samsung is noisy and the replacement catridge is definitely more expensive than Minolta's. Samsung electronic products are cheaper than name brands, but the quality is not that good. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bibin Mathews

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the speed & quality for the price. Would love to find a color Laser Jet with quality photos for a reasonable price like this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Riker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and simple
customer_reviews.text: Love these printers! Solid, simple and I can find pretty cheap toner for them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Just Plain Cheesy!
customer_reviews.text: Puchased this printer recently since it is networkable and I wanted to replace my old Brother printer. It looks great out of the box- nice and small, and black on silver. That is where the good news ends unfortunately. When I first turned on the printer there is a loud whirling noise and it comes on again everytime you print. Also, the paper curls unbelievable due to the sharp curve in the print output deck. These things never happened with my old Brother 1440. I guess Brother is just trying to make cheap printers, both in terms of cost and quality. This one is a shoddy product and I would spend the money to get something decent!
customer_reviews.author: Bigmac

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied so far with this printer. I am delighted with the price and the print quality. Set up was 1 2 3 easy.
customer_reviews.author: John Bellas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommanded this printer for me. I bought it in few weeks later. When it warm up, it is a little bit noisy. After few minutes later, it gets better. I'm very lucky 'cause my friend gave me the usb cord. That would saved me a lot. Entirely, I recommand this printer. It prints fast and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Sara YIU

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very good service and fast! We were very happy when we got the product.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Queen

customer_reviews.title: nice at a cost
customer_reviews.text: fast, crisp, cheap upfront, expensive drum and not many selling it
customer_reviews.author: Yervant Khatcherian

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: I was never informed that I was getting refurbished printers. When I complained I didn't receive an answer for over a week. Then the answer said that I may return them but only if they didn't work. I am disgusted with AMAZON and will never order from AMAZON again.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Costello

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal...
customer_reviews.text: a lot of people seem to be complaining that this printer doesn't come with the usb cable...these people are retarded..what printer comes with cables nowadays?...you can get a usb cable cheap for around $6 at a lot of places...should samsung and amazon supply you with printing paper and electricity to operate this printer also?...stop being cheap and go out buy your own usb cable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Laser printer at a good price, however extremely noisy and printing quality is light and grey.
customer_reviews.author: Kaveka

product_meta.title: Samsung ML-2010 Mono Laser Printer
product_meta.description:
It's the fastest printer in its class, but it never breaks a sweat. With its sleek design and ultra-compact footprint, the ML-2010 laser printer looks good in any home or small office, even at the end of its most action-packed days. Whatever the workload, it always delivers unparalleled productivity. Print speeds up to 22 ppm are simply unmatched in the class. And even at full speed, every document features sharp text and graphics with 1200 x 600 resolution. For added efficiency, TonerSave mode increases toner yield by up to 40% with the press of a button. You can save even more paper by easily printing two or more pages on a single sheet. Or, print transparencies, labels, envelopes and more, directly from the 150-sheet input tray if you'd like. There's also a convenient Cancel button to stop a print job instantly. Getting set up is quick and easy, too. Just connect the ML-2010 to your computer's USB port, install the software with just four clicks of the mouse and you're ready to go. Changing the toner is also a one-step process. Although, with a 3,000-page yield, it isn't something you do very often.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
It's the fastest printer in its class, but it never breaks a sweat. The Samsung ML-2010 laser printer packs fast, professional-quality printing at up to 22 ppm into a compact footprint. Suitable for any home or small office, it gives you top-rated performance, easy-to-use features and a stunning design. 

 Fast and economical printing without sacrificing desk space It's the fastest printer in its class, but it never breaks a sweat. The Samsung ML-2010 monochrome laser printer packs fast, professional-quality printing at up to 22 ppm into a compact footprint. Suitable for any home or small office, it gives you top-rated performance, easy-to-use features and a stunning design. 

 Compact, stylish design With a small 14-by-12-inches footprint, the ML-2010 is barely larger than the sharp, crisp documents it prints. 

 Fastest in its class With 22 ppm (letter) print speed and a first page out time of less than 10 seconds, you won't have to wait. 

 Economical Our TonerSave feature extends cartridge life by up to 40%, while still producing high quality prints. 

 Simple Setup You'll be up and printing in just a few mouse clicks. You don't even have to restart your computer. 

 Simple Usage Front access panels makes changing toner and adding paper a snap. 

 Samsung Reliability More than 20 years of design and manufacturing experience has led to document imaging products known throughout the world for their outstanding reliability. 

 Feature include: 

 * Up to 22 ppm print speed 
 * First page out in less than 10 seconds 
 * Ultra-compact and stylish design 
 * Up to 1,200 x 600 dpi effective resolution 
 * 150 sheets input, 100 sheets output 
 * 5,000 pages per month duty cycle 
 * TonerSave extends cartridge life up to 40% 
 * USB 1.1 connectivity, compatible with USB 2.0 
 * Compatible with Windows, Macintosh, Linux 

 What's in the Box: Printer, toner cartridge, power cord, CD-ROM, quick install guide, paper cover, user manual.
feature_bullets: Up to 1200 x 600 dpi effective resolution
Up to 22 ppm print speed with first page out in less than 10 seconds
150 sheets input and 100 sheets output paper input/output capacity
Plain paper/transparencies/ envelopes/labels/card stock media types

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars212 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
